utils

Class Vector4

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.Vector4

  • public class Vector4
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores two floating-point values ( x , y , z , w ) Used for matrix multiplications and basically nothing else
    Author:
    Vee

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float w
      W-component of this point
      float x
      X-component of this point
      float y
      Y-component of this point
      float z
      Z-component of this point

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector4()
      Constructs an identity Vector4 (0, 0, 0, 1)
      Vector4(float[] arr)
      Constructs a Vector4 from an array of given values.
      Vector4(float x, float y, float z, float w)
      Creates a Vector4 with the given arguments.
      Vector4(Vector2 v)
      Constructs a Vector4 that represents the same position in space as the given Vector2

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float[] getArray()
      Gets all the components of this vector Useful for interfacing with OpenGL

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vector4

        public Vector4()
        Constructs an identity Vector4 (0, 0, 0, 1)

      • Vector4

        public Vector4(Vector2 v)
        Constructs a Vector4 that represents the same position in space as the given Vector2

      • Vector4

        public Vector4(float x,
               float y,
               float z,
               float w)
        Creates a Vector4 with the given arguments. Maybe don't use this.

      • Vector4

        public Vector4(float[] arr)
        Constructs a Vector4 from an array of given values. Identical in function to Vector4(float, float, float, float)
        Parameters:
        arr - The array of values to use. Must have at least four elements.

    • Method Detail

      • getArray

        public float[] getArray()
        Gets all the components of this vector Useful for interfacing with OpenGL
        Returns:
        a four-element float array containing the X, Y, Z and W-components of the vector
